Class GameRPS_GUIcontroller

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameRPS_GUIcontroller

  • public class GameRPS_GUIcontroller
extends java.lang.Object
    class that contains all the developer designed code for the gameGUI

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Game clientGame
      creates an instance of the game
      private javafx.scene.control.TextField compWins
      textField that keeps track of how many times the computer has won the round
      private javafx.scene.control.TextArea gameOutput
      text area that updates after every round telling the user what the bot chose as a move, what their move was, and who won or if there was a tie
      private javafx.scene.control.TextField humanWins
      textField that keeps track of how many times the human user has won the round
      private javafx.scene.control.Button moveButton
      used by the human player to tell the game they have chosen their next move
      (package private) javafx.collections.ObservableList<java.lang.String> moveList
      List used so the client can only pick valid game moves
      private javafx.scene.control.ComboBox moveOptions
      allows the user to pick their move
      private javafx.scene.control.TextField numTurnsInput
      place for the user to decide and input how many rounds they want to play with the bot
      private javafx.scene.control.TextField remainingTurns
      keeps track of each round and reminds the user how many rounds are left
      private javafx.scene.image.ImageView ruleVisual
      image display container to hold a visual representation of the game rules
      private javafx.scene.control.TextArea ruleWriting
      word display of which moves beat what other moves.
      private javafx.scene.control.Button startButton
      used only once to tell the game that the user is ready to begin and has input the number of turns they want to play.

      • ruleWriting

        private javafx.scene.control.TextArea ruleWriting
        word display of which moves beat what other moves. Is Sheldon Cooper's line from Big Bang Theory

      • numTurnsInput

        private javafx.scene.control.TextField numTurnsInput
        place for the user to decide and input how many rounds they want to play with the bot

      • remainingTurns

        private javafx.scene.control.TextField remainingTurns
        keeps track of each round and reminds the user how many rounds are left

      • startButton

        private javafx.scene.control.Button startButton
        used only once to tell the game that the user is ready to begin and has input the number of turns they want to play. If the user doesn't input a number and arbitrary one is chosen and if the user inputs some character that can not be turned into an integer the user will have to try again for the start button to perform its function

      • moveButton

        private javafx.scene.control.Button moveButton
        used by the human player to tell the game they have chosen their next move

        allows the user to pick their move
